simplenlg.realiser
Class SPhraseSpec

java.lang.Object
  simplenlg.realiser.Spec
      simplenlg.realiser.PhraseSpec
          simplenlg.realiser.SyntaxPhraseSpec
              simplenlg.realiser.SPhraseSpec

public class SPhraseSpec
extends SyntaxPhraseSpec

simplenlg.SPhraseSpec is a simple syntactic representation of a sentential phrase.

It consists of

  • cue phrase
  • frontModifier(s)
  • subject(s)
  • verb (including particle)
  • complement(s)
  • modifier(s)
These are linearised in the above order

Also various simplenlg.features: tense, form, passive, negated, progressive

The simplenlg.features of a sentence are inherited by its verb phrase; this is updated every time a change is made to the sentence properties, because SPhraseSpec has a java.beans.PropertyChangeSupport.

Author:
ereiter -- Ehud Reiter 15-Feb-06 adapted by F. Hielkema, May 2007

getVerbGroup

public VerbGroupSpec getVerbGroup()
Returns:
The VerbGroupSpec of this sentence. Unlike getVerb(), this methof will return the verb group object.

setVerb

public void setVerb(Object verb)
sets verb (replaces existing verb). A particle can be specified, for example "split up". Using this method, the verb group of the sentence can be specified using simply a String (this is then internally rendered as head of the VerbGroupSpec of the sentence.

setVerb

public void setVerb(Verb verb)
sets verb (replaces existing verb)

Parameters:
verb - An instance of Verb

addVerb

public void addVerb(String verb,
                    Anchor a)
Add a verb (in addition to the existing verb). This means that the verb group in this sentence is now a coordinate, i.e. an instance of CoordinateVerbGroupSpec. All verb phrases will inherit the tense, passive, negated, progressive and perfect simplenlg.features of the sentence. E.g.:
  • the man walks and talks (present tense)
  • the man is walking and talking (progressive)
  • the man had been walking, talking and singing (past, perfect, progressive)

setParticle

public void setParticle(Object particle)
Sets the verb particle.

See Also:
setVerb(java.lang.Object)

setVerbGroup

public void setVerbGroup(VerbGroupSpec vp)
Like setVerb(Verb), but using a full VerbGroupSpec. This results in the sentence having the argument vp as its verb phrase, that is, this method will replace whatever verb group the SPhraseSpec had. Note that the sentence will inherit all the tense/aspect simplenlg.features of the verb group.

Parameters:
vp - The VerbGroupSpec.

setForm

public void setForm(Form f)
             throws SimplenlgException
This method sets the "form" (ininitive, gerund or default) of the sentence. By convention, mood has precedence over form, so that if the sentence mood has been set and it is incompatible with the new form, an exception is thrown. For example, the imperative mood is incompatible with the gerund form.

This method calls the VerbGroupSpec.setForm(Form) method of the child VerbGroupSpec.

Parameters:
f - The Form of this sentence.
Throws:
{@link - simplenlg.exception.SimplenlgException} if the selected form is incompatible with the Mood of the sentence.
SimplenlgException
See Also:
simplenlg.features.Form#isCompatible(Mood)}, VerbGroupSpec#setForm(Form)}

setProgressive

public void setProgressive(boolean prog)
sets whether the sentence is progressive aspect.

For example,

  • "John eats" (not progressive)
  • "John is eating" (progressive)

Parameters:
prog - progressive aspect if true

setNegated

public void setNegated(boolean neg)
sets whether the sentence is negated.

For example,

  • "John eats" (not negated)
  • "John does not eat" (negated)

Parameters:
neg - sentence is negated if true

getHead

public String getHead()
Description copied from class: PhraseSpec
returns the head of a phrase.

Head depends on type; for example, the head of an SPhraseSpec is the verb.

Specified by:
getHead in class PhraseSpec
